Krauthammer: Trump Must Attack Obstructionists To Overcome Them “This is a chronic issue ..." by Jack Davis February 20, 2017 at 6:56am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Conservative pundit Charles Krauthammer said Friday that President Donald Trump needs to harness popularity to attack those within the government who are leaking information and stalling implementation of Trump’s agenda. 
“You’ve got to get the same people to carry out a weakening of their own powers,” he said on Fox News. “For that, you need a president with a lot of public support .” Advertisement - story continues below McCain Takes Trump’s Worldview To Task In Fiery Munich Speech 
“This president has the two houses of Congress with him, so this is an opportunity to do that, and deregulation is one way to do that and depopulation of the bureaucracy, to allow the numbers to go down by attrition, is another way to do that.” 
Krauthammer said the problem is not unique to Trump. 
“It started with the New Deal and it’s not going to be ended with one presidency,” he said. Advertisement – story continues below 
“It’s one of the main conservative arguments against big government,” Krauthammer explained. “It’s not that it’s just inefficient, it’s not just that it’s impersonal, it’s not just that in the way that it restricts our liberties, it’s that it develops its own interests.” 
Long-time government employees who have seen presidents come and go can also serve as roadblocks, Krauthammer said. 
“Every time a new person comes in and enters the cabinet, becomes the head of a department, they instantly discover that there are people who are entrenched, have been there forever who know the ropes and can foil you simply by delaying,” he added. Advertisement - story continues below
